channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dead street tree by no. 32 Maury Road, 9th October
item.description:
This tree died in winter 2024/25 and didn't grow any leaves this year 2025. Would be great if it could be replaced in the next tree planting season.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Maury Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: What is the mayor of the borough of hackney doing about a illegal modified e-bikes, delivery companies just eat,deliveroo driving illegal on public roads, pedestrian pavements, reaching speeds of 30 to 70 mph nearly hurting members of public on a daily basis. Also lime bike being abandoned and dumped in and around surrounding neighborhoods causing anti-social behavior and damaged to people's property.What action is the mayor doing about this. Members of public are seriously being injured by these sort of e-bikes and rushed to A&E department royal London. The mayor of Hackney needs to take action and guidance policies., 9th October
item.description:
The mayor of Hackney does not care about the impact these line bikes and illegal modified E-bikes are having on members of public. Long as Hackney council's pockets are lined with investment from these sort of bikes they don't care.ASB

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hillman Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unsafe tree branches - too tall, not maintained & dangerous as you can see from shed damage, 9th October
item.description:
The trees on the rubbish land behind our houses are getting completely out of control, they are snapping and falling on properties, there are a large number of rats due to no maintaining of land and a worry for everyone when using the garden. Any wind and we know something will fall and damage more of shed!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gilbert Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree has come down, 9th October
item.description:
No suitable sub category for this! Tree right on boundary of Lyndhurst flats (Willow Grive Chislehurst) with Willow Vale has rotted and come down in Willow Vale. Not sure if private or street tree but suspect former. Trunk been moved to side on pavement and branch on gardens of flats. Please can it be removed and adjoining silver birch be checked? Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Willow Vale, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Communal bins not emptied on Tuesday 7th October, 9th October
item.description:
The communal.bins are normally emptied on a Tuesday each week. This week the communal bins have not been emptied, dont know why! I would be very grateful if the bins from binstore 29, Woolwich/Lewisham Court , at Eden Close, EN3 6YN, could be emptied. They are just starting to overflow and if not emptied, rubbish is going to start to pile up. Thank you for looking into this. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Hodson Place, London
Report on FixMyStreet
